website_summaries.verdict: A professional-grade tire pressure gauge with a dependable analog dial readout and a snug fit on the valve stem. Worth the investment.
pros: Bleeder valve allows for minor adjustments
Pros praise its accuracy and luminous dial
cons: Tends to read several pounds higher over time
Air can bleed out quickly after reading

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a total of four (4) Jaco Tire pressure gauges assuming that all four would read the same air pressures, I was very wrong. Four tire pressure gauges and only one tire pressure gauge accurate PSI. Someone needs to calibrate the tire air pressure gauges better or something???? I am disappointed in two things why list it as calibrated?; and how could all four (4) gauges read different tire air pressures?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Great gauge and value.
customer_reviews.text: This gauge appears to be accurate, consistent and sturdy. Especially good value. Updated on October 30, 2018... I’ve changed my rating after only four months of use from 5 stars to 1 star. The gauge reads 4-5 psi less than several other gauges that I own, including another gauge that looks to be made by the same manufacturer, but is labeled with another name.
customer_reviews.author: Shark Table Man

customer_reviews.title: Looks like no return/replace after 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a while - then started leaking after a few months so the needle no longer holds on the high reading. I am a hobbyist - so this has not been used heavily. Looks like no return/replace after 30 days, so I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: dpeterson13

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great quality... durable ... I love mine!!.... Update..now 1.5 years or so later it reads 10 psi high and no wayto calibrate..only use it so often ......not durable
customer_reviews.author: Bert Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Is not accurate, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay attention to the poor reviews and decided to purchase anyway. Unfortunately I found that this product is inaccurate, please do not purchase for your tire safety, especially if you're using it for any racing tire applications.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: More junk from Jaco
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Jaco product and this is the 3rd piece of junk I have gotten. The hose leaks gauge doesn't want to turn so you can read it
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tynes

customer_reviews.title: You'll lose 1/2 -1 PSI trying to get a seal
customer_reviews.text: Overall inconvenient to use. I lose 1/2 -1 PSI trying to get a decent seal to measure air pressure each time. Should be a screw on. Can't return now - going to buy a different brand (although this gauge is essentially a generic rebrand).
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Reading 10 lbs high, would not go to zero.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the gauge on very first use. I measures three tires and by the time I got to the fourth, the gauge would not go to zero and read 10 lbs high on all previously measured tires.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT DROP!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the gauge at first, but after setting the pressure on my truck, I set it on my grill. Well the hose straightened itself, pulling the gauge off the grill and fell about 3, 4 ft. So I immediately went back to my truck rechecked the tires, and now it reads 5 psi higher than what I set them. So even with the rubber cover, it is now WAY off. So what's to say during shipping, it gets dropped, was it ever really accurate to begin with. There really isnt a way to calibrate. I'll be looking for a more durable gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Jabone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Analog Tire Gauge
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I have had both analog and digital gauges in the past - both types have pros/cons. I like the features and materials of this analog one better than other units I've had from other manufacturers. The seller has done an excellent job of following up after order to make sure everything went fine. I like the lifetime warranty offer - hopefully I never have to replace this, but if I do, hopefully the seller is as helpful as they have been so far. I am also considering getting a digital inflator gauge as well, and looking at various manufactures including Jaco. Some offer more accessories, but also needing to weigh against quality and lifetime warranty consideration with Jaco.
customer_reviews.author: KFromOhio

customer_reviews.title: A must have gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I already carry a tire pressure gauge in my car and just wanted something more professional and also check my previous one for accuracy. The scale on the Jaco is great! Very easy to read and the flexibility provides even more easier use. Both the hose and the brass ends are solid quality. Haven’t tried the glow spec but good to have additional features. Not sure when you will need to check tire pressure in dark but again good to have. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Busybeeerc

customer_reviews.title: JACO Elite Pro 60psi Pressure Gage
customer_reviews.text: The gage came in decent packaging and appears well made. It checks within a half pound of my 40 year old G.H.Meiser 100psi gage, but is much easier to read since it has a larger graduated 60psi scale. The dial does indeed glow in the dark when exposed to a flashlight which could be handy at night. I like the rubber finned outer cover which adds protection from impacts, plus makes it more comfortable to hold when cold. My only concern would be the dual swivel action of the attachment points which could possibly leak, but only time will tell. And unfortunately it's made in China like everything else these days.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisLJ

customer_reviews.title: Can’t call it calibrated if the gauge doesn’t start a 0 psi
customer_reviews.text: I decided to splurge for a calibrated-accurate and easy to read/use tire gauge. This costs 10x of those “keep it simple” stick gauges I usually buy at the auto parts stores. Money NOT well spent. The gauge I received had its needle reading 6-7 psi under 0 psi of pressure. Can’t see how this gauge has been calibrated when it doesn’t start at “0”. (Yes, I know how to bleed out any residual pressure that the gauge is using to “hold” a reading). Returned for a refund rather than replacement as I wouldn’t have confidence in quality control or readings of an exact replacement.
customer_reviews.author: EZBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire Gauge I’ve Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is exactly what I wanted. The pressure-sensing end is angled perfectly to allow a good seal on the valve stem - at any angle or without regard for the stem position as the wheel sits. Touching the valve stem reads the pressure and a valve in the air line holds the gauge needle in place do you can read it. Tap the button on the air line and the needle drops to zero. I bought two the first time. I think it’s the best air gauge for tires I have ever used. I’m buying another for a friend who is learning about keeping an eye on tire air pressures - the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Old Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, very accurate gauge, I trust it with my race tires
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a very accurate gauge for measuring and setting cold and hot pressures for motorcycle track tires. I compared this against multiple gauges and a Milton Air Compressor regulator. Its dead on. Wrong pressures quickly destroy $420 sets of race tires, this is a great deal, and I have no doubt will pay for itself many times over.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dresden

customer_reviews.title: High quality tool that does its job extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Really well built, high quality tool to do a Simple thing that most other air pressure tools don't do well. The end of the tool swivels so you don’t have to twist and turn your body and the gage to measure air pressure on the side of the road in the rain. It locks the needle result on the gage so you can lift The Gage and read it carefully. the needle release button resets the needle back to zero PSI and also can be used to bleed off extra air pressure if you overfill. So many people design tire pressure gages badly - this is a really good one.
customer_reviews.author: vicki w.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the extra few bucks over the cheaper options availible on amazon
customer_reviews.text: Pretty damn accurate. Used on everything from our suv, truck, lawn tractors and a few atvs. Jaco claims within 2% accuracy but with my testing it's about 1%. When tested against a $400 digital intercomp this $25 gauge "was $29 when I bought it" is .25 to .30 of a psi difference "about 1/4 of a psi". Pros: Large easy to read dial that glows in the dark Sturdy hose Holds it's psi reading without leaking, I've left it filled at 35 psi for 4 days to test for leak/bleeding. Cons: Haven't found any yet... I just wish it had an option for a case
customer_reviews.author: Eric aka SouthernSorrow

customer_reviews.title: Rubish - Don't Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: The gauge initially was accurate, but after a couple months I discovered that the pressure reading is higher than actual. I discovered this after the TPMS on a couple cars started to display low tire pressure readings. At first I thought the tires were loosing air, but when this happened on more than one car, I used the Jaco gauge and it showed the pressure to be the same as the manufacturers set points. I then checked it with 2 digital gauges and found the actual pressure was 6 to 8 PSI low. I then tried to trouble-shoot the Jaco gauge and discovered that the needle zeros out at 6 PSI. These are dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I've been using a pencil style gauge for years. It served it's purpose but was a bit of a pain to use. You'd have to over inflate then seat the gauge, check pressure, release a little, re-seat, release a little etc. Re-seating was difficult sometimes, resulting in losing more air than you wanted. Not with this new gauge. Over inflate. Seat the tip(seats VERY well) then just push the air release button until the pressure has reached your desired number. Readings match my pencil gauge. Quick and easy. Sturdy too.
customer_reviews.author: maggot

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit bulky but extremely accurate. You have to screw it on the tire valve to get the pressure reading, instead of just pushing it on the valve. So that is more time-consuming; but with that comes better accuracy. Unscrew it quickly so you don't lose significant air. Other than that, it's a great product and it seems very reliable and accurate. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Keto Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Rock Star Tire Guage. Has it all: Easy to use, Durable, Air bleed push button
customer_reviews.text: Needed an accurate tire gauge to replace my wildly inaccurate stick version. Got this and they did this one right. Rubber protective cover on the gauge, easy to read face with one pound increments, swivel hose and tip plus it hold the reading so you can take the reading and remove the gauge for viewing. A small push button releases the air and resets it for the next tire. It also doubles as a handy bleed valve if you filled the tire a bit too much, just press release and check the pressure in the tire. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: Stuckshutter

customer_reviews.title: Used this a few times already and I love it. Very well made and seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few times already and I love it. Very well made and seems to be accurate, compared to the 1/2 a dozen or so gauges that I have. This could be the best gauge that I have now, all the others were more expensive, and some are digital, but this one just feels right. Don't mind that it is a little on the large side, but if this gauge holds a for at least 5 years, and I plan to use it just about every day. That's why it did not get the 5 stars, saw mix reviews on longevity, but from the feel of this gauge I think it will get the 5 stars. Thanks Jaco!
customer_reviews.author: Nor

customer_reviews.title: Good air pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good gauge for my new truck (I plan on airing down the tires a lot). And I wanted a gauge that would be reliable (no dead batteries) and accurate. I have several other gauges that all read the same and this gauge read the same so I assume it is accurate. It is reliable because there is no battery or electronics to go bad. It holds the reading until you reset it, so you just press it on, take a reading and reset it. It has a flexible hose so it can get into tight spots and appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: Best pressure gauge I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I own a handful of JACO products and after trying the "high end" Slime gauge which was not accurate at all, didn't fit well on tire stems, and the pressure relief valve broke after several uses, I decided to get one from JACO. This unit is ROCK SOLID! It is dead-on accurate, it fits flawlessly on my tire stems, is usable at night, and has the pressure-hold feature, making it super easy to use. I can't believe I have wasted money on multiple pressure gauges over the past year when I should have just bought this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Customer service as great as the product itself
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tire pressure gauge, and far easier to use and more accurate than most of the other poor quality ones I’ve had in recent years. It is durable and dependable. What has amazed me the most though is he customer service from Jaco. I have received several emails from the owner of the company keeping me up to date on the shipping status and making sure I was satisfied with my purchase. We’re not talking about an expensive item here, but they are giving me first rate attention and concern with my satisfaction. Very impressed all around.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goyette

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally nice Pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: I had digital one before and regardless if not used often need a battery replacement. I like old school with a dial reading. The valve makes a perfect seal and lets no air escape when attached to tire valve. Then you can take the gauge off and read it at leisure. I have been told the TPM units on cars nowadays are very accurate and this gauge is spot on. The hose to the gauge is nice and long so it never gets in the way of measurement. All in all a very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: electonics hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect At This Point
customer_reviews.text: By far, without question, this is the best tire gauge I've ever owned in my many decades of driving. I love all its features, particularly the quick and easy seal it makes when you attach it to the valve. My biggest complaint about other gauges over the years has been the loss of compressed air when trying to acquire an adequate seal. This may be a little pricey, but worth every nickel! (I've only used this once on four tires on a single car, and I'll update this post if something goes wrong.)
customer_reviews.author: Jamsie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after six months
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good for a while, but now it has become inconsistent. Sometimes it'll say 50 psi and then when you try again it'll say 25. A real shame that is as it seemed to be working for a long time. I have been real careful with it, no dropping etc., but I guess mine was just malfunctioning product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use it to keep the tire pressure in my motorcycle tires at the correct pressure constantly to get good wear and more miles out of a set of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased numerous types of tire pressure gauges and found that most differ from one another and are not very accurate. This gauge is spot on. I use it to keep the tire pressure in my motorcycle tires at the correct pressure constantly to get good wear and more miles out of a set of tires. I actually made this purchase back in October and wanted to get a lot of use out of it before I gave it a review. Five stars hands down. I highly recommend this gauge.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Received a woefully inacurrate gauge.
customer_reviews.text: I used this brand new Jaco gauge to measure the inflation pressure of a tire I was pretty certain was near 28 psi. The gauge read 23 psi. Hmmm... So I pulled out my old mechanical gauge and it read nearly 28 psi. Then I bought a high-quality stick gauge AND a Jaco digital gauge so I could see which was really correct. The photo speaks for itself. Every other gauge (including a cheapo keychain digital and an old-fashioned stick) says the tire is 28 psi. This Jaco mechanical gauge? 23 psi. Jaco says, "calibrated accurate within ANSI Standards (±1.5%) at our NIST accredited industrial facility". I don't think so, Jaco.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B.

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell, but for now, this gauge is great. It is more for home use, but it could also be carried around if needed. The relief valve helps in deflating tires to the proper pressure. This is the second one I received from JACO. The first one I assume, was not properly calibrated, the needle did not go back to zero. Also, there was some foreign particles inside the dial. I contacted JACO and they had a replacement shipped the same day. Great after sale service.
customer_reviews.author: Lannister

customer_reviews.title: This is very easy to use and understand....
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a good buy. This product is heavy duty built. The features makes it easy to read...even in low light. The pressure release button gives you the ease of getting the proper pressure simple. This IS better than the other gauge we are use to keeping 8n our glove compartment. The swivel tip and base doesn't make it uncomfortable to use in any position you put yourself into. I like it...even though its bigger...it is better.
customer_reviews.author: Emani2

customer_reviews.title: High quality and accurate readings
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the JACO ElitePro Tire Pressure Gauge - 60 PSI | JACO Lightning S-Series Air Chuck (2 Pack)! I also have another JACO tire pressure gauge and the air chuck quick release. One is for always carrying in my truck and the other for my ebike in the forest. All the products work as advertised and are made of high quality materials. Air gauges at the air pumps at mini marts and gas stations are highly inaccurate. With the JACO air gauges I know that I'm getting an accurate air pressure reading. The quick disconnect chucks really work. I highly recommend the JACO products.
customer_reviews.author: Jetsetmantony

customer_reviews.title: JACO ElitePro Tire Pressure Gauge - 60 PSI
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a Tire Pressure Gauge ... doesn't make cupcakes ... won't take your blood pressure ... but what it WILL do is accurately measure the PSI in your tires, which is important. I has a ridged surface surrounding the display, which makes it easier to hold. The arm that attaches to the tire stem has a swiveling top, which is convenient for the angle most comfortable to you. The service was very fast via AMAZON. Well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: off 2 psi as long as it gets no worst then that I can live with that. first one off 1 psi. one in each vehicle and 2 in my tool box. I don't want to be with out one. my tire last a long time, wheel alignment every 5000miles. life time check from Firestone., tire rotation at the same time, free, if you buy them from them. check tire every 2 weeks make adjustment at that time if it need one. my tires dry rot before I wear them out. every 6 years buy the top of the line. well worth keeping up with maintenance. Save the environment and my wallet at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: KNN.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my travel tool bag so I don't use it very often. As a result this review is premature. My last pressure gauge just stopped reading accurately after a year. Having a tool that works year over year is important to me, so time will tell. That said, I used it once and it works GREAT. I like that it has two rotation points and a flexible hose making it convenient to access the valves on my dirt bikes. In addition, the dial has large numbers and is easy to read. Seems nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Zeimet

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my motorcycle and Jeep. Works like a charm. Easy to use and great quality. I wanted something analog (didn’t want to fuss with batteries and the like), and this fit the bill. Can’t imagine anything else working better. Would highly recommend. My Jeep computer has been on the fritz lately re: tire pressure, and I was 99% sure the computer was not working correctly. Using this simple piece of equipment confirmed my suspicions. Kind of ironic that something like this works better.
customer_reviews.author: mickeymouse

customer_reviews.title: JACO ElitePro Tire Pressure Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an accurate tire pressure gauge and I think I have finally found one in the Jaco Elite Pro. The rotating chuck and pressure gauge make it easy to accurately check my tires. So far so good, only recommendation would be to coat the chuck in a rubberized coating to keep the brass from accidentally nicking your wheels finish
customer_reviews.author: Bob Reid

customer_reviews.title: Quality Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer sent me an email before the product arrived, and predicted I would love it. It arrived on time, and he was right. This was just what I needed to quickly get an accurate tire pressure reading on my C7 Stingray. It appears to be a sturdy, quality-made product, and comes with a lifetime guarantee. I like the 360 deg swivel at the base of the hose and the brass attachment. I especially like that if the tire is over-inflated you can just bleed the pressure down to the desired PSI without removing the guage. Highly recommend this product for its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Best Pressure Gauge I ever used!
customer_reviews.text: "This gauge is absolutely awesome. There is a few inch long hose that swivels at both ends making attaching to the valve from any angle or position a breeze. It also attaches to the valve with a good seal with no air leakage for an accurate reading. I also love how the pressure is locked until you release it. The best tire gauge I have ever owned and recommend it highly."
customer_reviews.author: kefamily5

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, this is a very sturdy, solid pressure gauge. I like the long hose, which makes it easy to use, and also the air release valve is very useful for both holding the pressure measurement and letting out excess air. Build quality is excellent and as far as I can tell, the measurement is accurate. I compared it to another digital gauge I've been using and their readings are consistent. The nice feature of this gauge is the hose that makes for more flexible (pun intended) applications.
customer_reviews.author: monkuboy

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality analog gauge from a good company
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these gauges and was so pleased, that I bought 2 more - one for each car and one for the house. They are very accurate, very well made and come with a lifetime warranty. After buying the first gauge, I was offered a 10% discount on my next purchase. This is a small company just getting started. I encourage you to give them a try. I've been very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and easy to use.  Liked it so much I bought two.
customer_reviews.text: Love this gauge! With the swivel head, it's very easy to take a tire pressure reading without having to manipulate the entire device at the precise angle to get a good reading. With other gauges, it seems I'm usually letting air out of the tire as I try and get a solid "fit" of the device over the valve. I also like the feature that it holds the reading on the gauge until you release it by pressing the small brass button. I aso like the rubber surrounding the dial. Easy to hold and protects the dial if you were to drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Okie Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I bought the JACO Elite first but found that I am too old to get under my motorcycle for that one. Also the hold pressure button failed fairly quickly. However customer service was very quick to refund me for that one with no questions asked. I ordered to ElitePro version with the short hose and find it soooo much easier for me to get down and check tire pressure. It's feels like a well built pressure gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for motorcycle tires too.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a motorcycle tire gauge and came across this one, I liked I can get into valve easy with turning extended hose, rubber bumper is great if you drop it, the pressure holder is great too for checking motorcycle tires, and glow light is nice to have if you got a problem at night, I just wished I bought this sooner, I never write this much, but it is a good one. And company wrote me twice to see if I was happy, I am.
customer_reviews.author: Redskin Fan

customer_reviews.title: JACO Elite Pro Tire Pressure Gauge 60 PSI
customer_reviews.text: OK, I ordered three of these, two read exact same pressure on same tire, the third was about .5 lbs more. I'll call that good enough. Very easy to use, without losing pressure and seem a lot more accurate than the gauges I just threw in the garbage. My gauges I just chucked would be off from each other by 5, that's FIVE lbs, so I never knew "who" was lying, and who was telling the truth. I'll call .5 lbs good!!!!!! Glad I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: FaSSBlac

customer_reviews.title: not accurate 3 months later
customer_reviews.text: Gauge is very accurate , rugged and looks like it will last a long time . I own an auto repair shop and my employee that changes the oil loves this gauge. Well had it for 3 months and it's 4 pounds heavy and called and left message with them, no return call .
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Best tire pressure gauge ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Jaco tire pressure gauge. I bought my first one over a year ago. I loved it so much that I bought a second one for a relative. The gauge is very easy to use. It engages the tire valve easily and reads the pressure right away. The gauge keeps the pressure reading visible while you remove it from the valve. Once you are happy with the reading, you press the release button and the gauge resets to zero. It is a very rugged gauge and the hose is made of heavy rubber. I think this gauge will last for many years. High recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Sue

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw your money away.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tire gauge 3 years ago. I paid over $22.00 for this gauge. It lasted 3 years. It no longer works. I have a pocket tire gauge that cost less than $5.00 that I bought over 15 years ago and it still works very good and accurate. The reason I bought this gauge is that I wanted a gauge that looks nice and thought would be good. It was accurate and easy to use but did not last for the money. If you want a gauge that will last 3 years I would recommend this gauge.
customer_reviews.author: William E Coss

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy from this company, they will spam you relentlessly. The gauge is sticky and doesn’t work consistently. I was able to get the job done, but don’t hold much hope for longevity. I had no intention of leaving a review, but the spamming finally got just that annoying, so here it is. The gauge is cheap China junk and the company is relentless with their emails.
customer_reviews.author: GFX

customer_reviews.title: Does not read low psi
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pressure gauge because it stated it read pressures from 0-60 psi. I have beach cart tires that can take no more than 3 psi. After putting some air in the tires and attaching the gauge, it failed to show a reading. I did not want to put any additional air in the tire over fear that the tire would be overinflated and pop. So as far as I am concerned, this product did not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: flicker

customer_reviews.title: Confidence in tackling job at hand.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this tire pressure gauge a few days before attempting to replace a pressure tank. I don't always take the time to write a review especially when I'm not impressed with the product but felt obligated since it did an excellent job. It was important I could trust the actual tank pressure because that allowed me to accurately set the cut in pressure to my house hold water pressure. I had previously returned an equivalently priced gage because I couldn't get it to sit properly on the valve stem, not the case with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jfabcity

customer_reviews.title: Junk, don't believe the 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made product, poor quality, bad workmanship. Gauge won't hold air, has a leak from the brass fitting. I bought a replacement gauge made by Longacre, it's 10x better quality. Not sure why the Amazon reviews for this item is 5 stars, I was bamboozled. This is maybe a 2 star product. You can tell right away that the materials are really cheap: the stiff rubber hose, the sloppy brass fittings, the junky plastic exterior. I had to return mine because it didn't work when it arrived. When I contacted the seller, they wanted me to rebuild it. I might rebuild a quality gauge after a couple years of use, but this is a garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Oster

customer_reviews.title: 2 of them broke
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could have an accurate tire gauge. The first one after a couple months would not return to zero and would not record proper pressure. JACO graciously replaced it for me. The replacement now does not measure properly. Measures low. TPMS on vehicle told me 31 lbs and the JACO 36. Embarrassing. I took car to dealer to check TPMS and they said tires were not inflated to 36. So much for a good tire gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: Finally we have tire gauges that work and feel durable. We do quite a bit of light offroad miles. Having a good quality tire gauge is a must. Design and rugged feel are great! "Forget the plastic gauges sold by auto parts dealers, this is the real thing. Precise, easy to use and robust. A little more expensive but built to last. Remember tires are vital for your safety and much more expnsive . I do some off road and why risk it?"
customer_reviews.author: Danson G. Tolman

customer_reviews.title: Does What It's Supposed to Do - It's All Good
customer_reviews.text: I have had some bad luck with air pressure gauges from another company as they just wouldn't seal. Now air is cheap, of course, but I use nitrogen in my tires so all that leaking is not only frustrating but expensive as well. The JACO unit seals very nicely and its readings correspond to other units that I have so I have confidence that it is reporting accurately. Now I know what PSI my tires are at and I'm happy because I'm pretty finicky about this. As usual, I reserve the 5th star for things that work over the long haul but I'm pretty sure this unit will perform very well for years.
customer_reviews.author: Houckster

customer_reviews.title: Seems Excellent, Definitely Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a standard pressure gauge against which to measure this one, so it's hard to tell the 'accuracy'. It's definitely easy to use and read. My only regret is that so few gas/petrol stations have 'real' air hoses anymore - frequently its a stand-alone device with a weak compressor activated by a credit card!
customer_reviews.author: Siegfried Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Quality and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of this gauge so far only used it a few times and the accuracy seems right on compared to my old digital gauge that can’t give me the same reading twice. I like that this gauge doesn’t let air out while trying to get a reading. I plan on getting another gauge to connect to my air compressor in the future.
customer_reviews.author: giftgiver

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, accurate and adaptable..
customer_reviews.text: I use my Jaco on my cars, motorcycle and riding lawn mower tires.. because it's adjustable at two locations on the hose, it's very easy to use on my cars and lawn mower. The front twin rotors on my bike's brakes makes getting to the valve a tight squeeze which is made a bit easier due to the adaptability of the Jaco, both for filling and then bleeding to get the exact PSI. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received a JAVO ELITE 0-60 p.s.i tire gauge that was not zeroing back out. I left a message for the seller to contact me. He said he saw that I had bought a tire gauge (for wife's car) in the past. I advised them that I have had great luck with my other JACO tire gauge. He not only made it right...he shipped out another gauge for NO CHARGE. He advised me that all JACO gauges have a 100% replacement guarantee if a gauge is defective. You don't get many honest people like that now-a-days. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this tire gauge!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn - Missouri

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire Pressure Gauge Ever
customer_reviews.text: Really like this pressure gauge: it is accurate, very easy to use for this senior citizen. My Outback has pressure reading sensors in the tires, so I inflated to specified pressure (on the inside door panel) using the Jaco and the dashboard readings are exactly the same, so I can rely on the Outback pressure sensors on trips. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P

customer_reviews.title: Best gauge I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made and accurate product. Easy to use and read. The only thing missing is a little nub on the connector to release air if you over inflate the tire, but I found you can just use the edge of the connector mouth. Highly recommend. So much better than my old mechanical stick type with the sliding gauge.
customer_reviews.author: blingboi33

customer_reviews.title: Best pressure gauge in my tool box!
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid and works very well. Heavy rubber case should provide protection and makes it easy to grasp. Dial is very easy to read. Really a quality tool. Best pressure gauge I've ever used or owned. Flexible hose fits into tight spots. Holds the reading until you can get a good look. Easy to read dial in 1lb increments. Easy to bleed air. Very pleased with this purchase."
customer_reviews.author: Hillz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and accurate readings
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best tire gauge I've ever owned. Why the gauge is upside down on the hose I don't understand, but it's not an issue with the swiveling hose connector that comes pre-assembled with the gauge and is ready to use right out of the box. Easy 5 stars from me. Buy it! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. RL

customer_reviews.title: Good practical gauge for cars and motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pressure gauge with a reasonable scale - 60 psi - ideal for normal vehicles. Why there are so many gauges with a scale of 150 psi or more is beyond my understanding, leading to large errors in the area of interest of around 35 psi. The Jaco gauge seems quite precise. I compared it with a couple of other good gauges I have and it was right on the money. By the way, I purchased it to use with my motorcycle where a few pounds of pressure make a noticeable difference. The flexible hose helps getting into tight spots between spokes and brake disks. I would have preferred a 90 degrees tip but it works well as is.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Useful and Usable
customer_reviews.text: Was purchased specifically to monitor the tire pressure of my motorcycle. And though a bit cumbersome to use (a bit difficult to align between spokes, I appreciate that the tire pressure reading "stays" after removing from tire; and also, the opportunity to relieve tire pressure using the gauge. Yes, I would recommend this tire pressure gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Classicrk

customer_reviews.title: Don't rely on the gauge at the air fill station!
customer_reviews.text: High quality product and best warranty!!! Great to use whenever the vehicle computer sends the message "Low Tire Pressure" and verify it's only air temperature sensitivity by the sensor. And, keeping it in the vehicle console provides the opportunity to immediately check whenever adding air and prevent over inflating. Highly recommend this gauge as a "must have" to maintain proper tire inflation.
customer_reviews.author: WildlifeBob

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, but good.
customer_reviews.text: It's not the usual Chinese made junk. It works really well. The rubber part surrounding the dial makes it look more heavy duty than what it really is, but that's ok. It's all about looks. I don't even mind that by buying this, I'm supporting cheap Chinese labor anymore. I've bought American made overpriced products that were just plain garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Hyme Dagreat

customer_reviews.title: Quick and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy to read dial, the rubber bumper guard protecting the gauge, but more importantly to me is the ability to swivel the head and hose thereby avoiding kinks. One other great design is the pressure relief valve on side...this great for dialing in exact pressure and resetting gauge to zero!
customer_reviews.author: Gyri Sulci

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived earlier than expected. The product is just as described. It is an easy to use tire pressure gauge. It allows you to lower the pressure while you look at the numbers so you won’t over do it. I highly recommend it if you like to be able to check your tire pressure accurately.
customer_reviews.author: AC in Dayton

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I got along without this before. I had the small pencil like thing you had to turn the right way and still not be able to read easily. This is so easy to use. Large numbers, flexible hose, you are in control of the direction and not the other way . Highly recommend for every vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: If You Want An Accurate Tire Pressure Gauge- Here It Is!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to splurge and finally get myself a professional tire pressure gauge since we acquired a 2018 Honda Sport 2.0 with a really finicky tire pressure monitoring system (TPMS). If you're off by 2 lbs of pressure the thing goes off. The JACO ElitePro Pressure is great. The cord allows you to get a good reading without crawling around on your hands and knee in the snow. Since it holds the pressure reading until you manually release it you don't have to wonder if you read it right each time you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wood

customer_reviews.title: Best tire pressure gage ever!
customer_reviews.text: Was using an electronic tire pressure gauge for many years but was hard to get a reading without losing air. This gauge is easy to use, doesn't need "muscle" to press onto tire stem and it takes a reading every time without the annoying air pressure loss from the tire. Will buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR MOTORCYCLE TIRES
customer_reviews.text: Motorcyle tire air pressure is hard to measure due to the large disc brakes. I tried 3 different gauges and none worked. Finally got smart with the JACO ElitePro. Couldn't be happier - - - superior design & features.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Hampton

customer_reviews.title: This tire pressure gauge is super easy to read and use!
customer_reviews.text: This tire pressure gauge is very handy for those of us needing reading glasses. The numbers are large and the dial is nicely incremented. It's easy to read how many pounds of pressure is in the tire. My car warns if tire pressure is low but doesn't give the current pressure so I'll know if it's safe to proceed. I'm not sure if it's 100% accurate, maybe a pound or so difference from the tire store. It's close enough for me. The only possible negative is that it's larger than the pen-style pressure gauges but so worth the extra space it takes up.
customer_reviews.author: Italy traveler

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: The Jaco Elite Pro Tire Pressure Gage far exceeds all other gages I have owned. My best tire pressure gage was an LED type , but it was reading 20 at 16 psi! Had to recheck all tire pressures. The Jaco is well built, easy to use and should provide years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great budget gauge
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to keep up on my tire pressure on my motorcycle and it seems to be working great. I got this to replace a gauge I had for years that fell apart so we'll see how long this one lasts. For the price if it lasts a couple years I'll be happpy.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AIR PRESSURE GAGE!!
customer_reviews.text: The gage was easy to use. The nozzle swivels 360 degrees and with the long hose it’s easy to take readings. I also like the unit holds the reading so you can take your time to look at the gage numbers. I didn’t give 5 stars for accuracy as It read 1 psi higher that the TPMS readings from my vehicle. My vehicle may be off. Either way, very close! The gage is rugged and well made. I expect to use this product for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: rich a

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Great communication with company!
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems great, only used it twice so far. Easy to use, accuracy seems good. Used for car tire, and bicycle tire pressures. Great communication from the company! They are with you from beginning purchase (“please let us know when you receive item” etc)
customer_reviews.author: BerBar

customer_reviews.title: High-quality guage at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: MY car, a 2008 Lexus ls 460, has a lot of sophisticated features, but the tire pressure monitoring system is rudimentary. After guessing which tire pressure number corresponds to which tire for a few seasons in this climate of extremes, I got smart and bought one of these gauges. Issue resolved. I got the gauge with the hose attached, as I thought that would facilitate its use. I believe I was right. I'd recommend this product to anyone who doesn't have a tire pressure monitoring system that indicates which tire corresponds to which pressure[number], and anyone in a place with extremes of temperature change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Excellent Condition
customer_reviews.text: Craftsmanship is excellent. Very well made high quality parts. The only I wish, is that these manual gauges were just as accurate as the digital ones or close. Perhaps also put in more tick marks to get more accurate readings. Other than that it is a great product! =)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical gauge
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an accurate mechanical gauge instead of replacing the batteries in my digital one. Also, it can't leak air or lose the reading when I use the release valve. This gauge meets those requirements and is a pleasure to use. I appreciate the rotation on both ends so I can easily get a flush fit on the valve stem. It reads a little high compared to my car's tpms, but seems to be within the 2% accuracy specs. I like the follow up I received from the company after the purchase, and there's a lifetime guaranty, but I don't expect to use it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: JACO is the real deal company to deal with..
customer_reviews.text: JACO sticks true behind their products. I only talk to them via e-mail as to when the JACO tire pump. They responded the next day and said "very soon" I was amazed to get a personal email that the pump was back on the shelves and they gave me an extra 20% discount on a 20% discount with a product discount code. I didn't ask them for it but regardless, they gave me one discount over the other one. Both the ElitePro tire gauge and the portable tire pump are both of exceptional quality. I stand back JACO products, they are fast to act on concerns I had. JACO is a quality company, which is rare these days..
customer_reviews.author: arcusmay

customer_reviews.title: Has the bleeder valve
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and accurate. What surprised me was I didn't zero the gauge when I used it a few weeks ago and when I went to use it again, it still showed the original pressure meaning that even after a few weeks, the gauge didn't leak. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Warranty Service
customer_reviews.text: Dropped mine and it would not go below 20 psi afterwards. Sent a quick email asking how to get warranty service. They asked for proof of purchase. I sent it and they immediately sent out a new one without question, Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is one accurate gauge
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this tire gauge as he is the pro when it comes to tire pressure and owns several gauges; however they are getting older and losing their accuracy. He tested this gauge against his other gauge tools and the reading was perfect. He likes the design of this gauge as well, as you can twist the connector in two places for ease of applying and reading the pressure. He highly recommends this product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Anais

customer_reviews.title: Love this pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: Because there is no battery, it works anytime. Along with that, it's easily adjusted for left-hand use whereas some of the other types are not - and the swivels make it easy to read the gauge no matter where the valve is. Double-checked the pressure readings, and they are quite accurate. I'd recommend this gauge to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality gauge but a little harder to use than the small digital ones
customer_reviews.text: Well made and probably more accurate than the cheap digital ones. No batteries needed is also nice. But it's bulky and can be a little harder to read quickly in low light compared to a lighted digital display unless you charge the glow in the dark display with light before using.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good product / good company
customer_reviews.text: It is a cool product. The dial is protected by the black soft impact ring. Accuracy appears to be good as it matches with the tire store and car dealer automated machines. (Two different vehicles) Shipped and arrived as promised. AND This is absolutely unheard of in this day and age. The company, JACO, sent a .PDF document of the user instructions in E-Mail prior to delivery. A real first class touch.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: The rolex of tire gauges
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is second to none. Unlike my other gauges, the chuck fits precisely and does not bleed air when inserting it to check air pressure. It bleeds in small increments so that I don't pass my desired psi easily and when I remove the chuck it holds the psi reading. Update. This is my second purchase. I also bought one for my brother who rents cars every other weekend. 90% of the cars he rents are dangerously over inflated. The last car he rented was over inflated by 10 PSI cold! This is one of the best gifts you can give to a loved one.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well built gauge.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Unit is SOLID! Obviously well built. Love that it holds the level when you release from the stem. Makes checking my spare tire under my truck much easier with the flexible hose. And speaking of the hose...also very sturdy/thick. Feels like I'll be able to hand this down to my kids, kids in 50 yrs! Not sure how to check for accuracy. My other gauges are cheap ($1- $3) ones from box-store. ALL three read different pressures. [+/- 2 psi] Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: JayTan

customer_reviews.title: The saying is: Where the rubber meets the road!
customer_reviews.text: I take that serious. I buy premium tires for every thing. I have been blaming the tire pressure sensors on my 2008 Chrysler T & C. I have been running 10 pounds low. Yes, I am old enough to know better. yes, the warning lights did go out.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I tested this against two other gauges that I'm using and it was spot on. Easy to use with the swivel ends.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: This tire gage is quite useful.
customer_reviews.text: I like this particular tire gage in all respects except one. It take two hands to hold it when taking measurements. I plan on giving it to my son and buying one or two of the same gage but without the tubing extender. It's a win-win. I also like the rubber which protects the gage if dropped or when stored in a tool box,
customer_reviews.author: debee

customer_reviews.title: Quality merchandise!
customer_reviews.text: I received my JACO ElitePro Pressure Gauge in two days and I am very pleased. Always wanted a quality air pressure gauge and after some research I decided on the Elite Pro. Easy to read, like the way it holds the pressure reading until I press the release button and the 2" gauge is easy to read. Quality it is! I am thinking about order some for Christmas gifts (for special friends and relatives). Before placing my order I read a few negative comments online but that is to be expected. By far the majority were very pleased and so am I Thanks for the follow up - another impressive move.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Almost a five
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid unit. I like the rotating nozzle. It holds the pressure nicely when you remove the nozzle so that you can read the pressure at your convenience. It would be a five-star except for: I use it for autocross racing where I frequently need to drop tire pressures by 2 or 3 pounds. This unit, if you wiggle the button a bit, releases pressure better than my old unit, but it's still slower than I'd like. When you're squatting and need to do all 4 tires, this is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: FootHiller

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy to use, and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be accurate. It reads the same as my pencil gauge, but much easier to use and read. It works great for checking both my car and motorcycle tires. It appears to be very well made, and very durable. The 0 to 60 PSI range is perfect, since all my tires are rated from 20 to 40 PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Glen P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Gauge is clear, glow function works as described, release button works well, product seems very well built. Gauge is more accurate than any others I own. Will be keeping this one in the truck and ordering another for her car. Highly recommend the product and the JACO team customer experience is top notch. Wish all the corp giants operated like this small company does. Thank you JACO!
customer_reviews.author: JGFL

customer_reviews.title: The good reviews are true
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a tire gauge, I bought this one after reading the many great reviews. I initially wanted one of the pen-like ones, but I'm glad I went with this one. It reads accurately and having the gauge pause on the reading so that you don't have to awkwardly fuss with it to read it as you fill/deflate is a simple yet important feature that sets it apart from others.
customer_reviews.author: Momma on the Go

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and accurate product with truly impressive customer service to back it up. While costing more than the cheap inaccurate gauges, I think it better protects the investments in my expensive mud terrain tires that I frequently air down.
customer_reviews.author: J-Mac

product_meta.title: JACO ElitePro Tire Pressure Gauge - 60 PSI
product_meta.description:
"Simply put: this is the BEST tire gauge out there!" ... "You will throw all your old gauges away" ... 

"A professional grade tool" ... "Ridiculously accurate & easy to use" ... 

"No batteries to wear out" ... "By FAR the best I have ever used!"



The JACO ElitePro Series has been crowned #1 "best of the best" tire pressure gauge by BestReviews, 2019. Never be without a reliable tire gauge when you need it most. After countless hours searching for & studying the best gauges on the planet, we are proud to introduce to you the ElitePro Series Tire Pressure Gauge by JACO Superior Products.



Why Choose The ElitePro?

- Flexible "No Leak" Air Hose

- 360-Degree Swivel Chuck

- Rubberized Gear-Style Protective Shock Guard

- Pressure Hold & Reset Button

- Built-in Air Bleeder Valve

- 0-60 PSI Range, Large 2" Glow-in-Dark Dial

- Built to Last From Solid Brass

- Rugged Steel Casing

- Calibrated accurate to ±1.5% at our NIST & ANSI certified lab

- Mechanic Recommended



Why Maintaining Proper Tire Pressure Is Crucial:

- Longer lasting tires by promoting proper and even tire tread wear patterns

- Improved fuel economy meaning less time and money spent at the gas pump

- Smoother vehicle performance and handling for a more enjoyable overall driving experience

- Increased driving safety by reducing the risk of tire failure due to under-inflation



Proudly Backed by Our LIFETIME 100% Satisfaction Guarantee!

 Order today while supplies last. Limited stock.

Sold exclusively by JACO Superior Products.
feature_bullets: Mechanic Recommended & Rated "Best of the Best" by Amazon Verified Experts: Performance tested, certified, & calibrated accurate within ANSI Standards (±1.5%) at our NIST accredited industrial facility, ensuring precise tire pressure readings without relying on batteries

Feels rugged in the hand & built to last from solid brass shielded by our durable shock-resistant rubberized protective guard; features our signature HybridFlex leak-proof air hose providing a soft feel with superior strength & flexibility
Robust design is equipped with a built-in air bleeder valve to reduce pressure in overinflated tires, and the handy 360-degree swivel chuck allows for easy access to the tire valve from any angle

Larger, 2" glow dial features easy-to-read 60 PSI single increment scale that glows in the dark, providing accurate readings that "lock" in place until the pressure reset button on the brass neck is pressed

FREE 100% Lifetime Satisfaction Guarantee by JACO Superior Products (for any reason) when you order today, so click "Add to Cart" with confidence and enjoy longer-lasting tires, improved gas mileage, and a smoother car driving experience

specifications.Special Features: The JACO ElitePro Tire Pressure Gauge helps maintain proper tire inflation with precise tire air pressure readings, while reducing uneven tire tread wear & extending tire life - features 0-60 PSI glow-in-dark scale for high visibility in dark conditions, air bleeder valve, pressure hold & reset functions, 10" flexible air hose, fully rotational tire chuck, and calibrated highly accurate to ANSI Grade B40.1 standards
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,755 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
